title: Poison Ingestion
summary: Emergency response for swallowed poisons. Call Poison Control (1-800-222-1222) immediately for specific guidance.

steps.title: Call Poison Control
steps.description: Call Poison Control at 1-800-222-1222 (US) immediately. Have container of poison ready to read label. They will guide specific treatment. If person is unconscious or having seizures, call 911 instead.

steps.title: Identify the Poison
steps.description: Find container if possible. Note: substance name, amount taken, time ingested, person's age and weight. Take container to hospital. Do not smell container to identify - may be harmful.

steps.title: Do NOT Induce Vomiting
steps.description: Never make person vomit unless specifically told by Poison Control. Some poisons cause more damage coming back up. Do not give ipecac syrup. Remove any remaining poison from mouth.

steps.title: Follow Poison Control Instructions
steps.description: They may recommend: water or milk to dilute (if conscious), activated charcoal, or specific antidotes. Only give what they specifically recommend. Keep person calm and still.

steps.title: Monitor and Support
steps.description: Watch for: difficulty breathing, seizures, unconsciousness, severe vomiting. If symptoms worsen, call 911. Save any vomit for analysis. Stay with person until help arrives or symptoms resolve.

warnings: Never give anything by mouth if person is unconscious
Do not try home remedies or induce vomiting without instruction
Some poisons have delayed effects - always seek guidance
whenToSeekHelp: Call Poison Control immediately for all poisonings
Call 911 if person is unconscious, seizing, or not breathing
Go to ER if Poison Control recommends or symptoms are severe
preventionTips: Store all chemicals and medications locked and out of reach
Keep products in original containers with labels
Post Poison Control number near all phones
